data.title: Leadership
data.meta_description: Leadership - DZS - Enabling the Hyper-Connected World
data.text:
Charlie Vogt has spent his professional career executing visionary strategies resulting in unprecedented growth in the broadband networking and software defined networking market segments.

Vogt is currently the CEO of DZS, a global leader in broadband networking, connectivity and cloud software solutions serving more than 250 Communication Service Providers with more than 20 million productsdeployed and 50 million software license subscriptions around the world. DZS represents marquee Service Provider such as Lumen, Brightspeed, TDS, UScelluar, Windstream, Consolidated Communications, Boingo, Coca-Cola, Telus, Bell Canada, DT, Orange, Telefonica, Vodafone, Sky, Freedom Fibre, NBN, Telstra, Aussie Broadband, Etisalat, STC, Mobily. DZS is publicly traded on the Nasdaq (DZSI).

Under Vogt’s leadership the company has executed company-wide product innovation, people, and systemstransformation; executed $100 million follow-on equity offering; four technology acquisitions, (Optelian, RIFT, CloudCheck/Expresse and NetComm) and record 2022 sales financial results of $400M Orders (62%^), $375M Revenue (15%^), and $304M Backlog (217%^).

Prior to DZS, Vogt was the Chairman and CEO of ATX Networks, a global leader in cable HFC, access networking and media distribution solutions serving more than 100 MSO Cable and Communication Companies including Comcast, Charter, Cox, Altice, Liberty Global, NBN and Dish. Prior to ATX Networks, Vogt was the CEO of Imagine Communications, a global leader of Media Content, Playout and Networking solutions serving more than 1,000 TV Networks, Broadcasters, MSOs, and new Media Providers spanning 100countries. After joining Harris Broadcast in July 2013, Vogt restructured, integrated, and rebranded the company – creating Imagine Communications and GatesAir; acquired three technology companies; launched the industry’s first XaaS for video playout and unified distribution; secured the industry’s first IP cloud playout network with Disney; founded Alliance for IP Multimedia Solutions; and increased sales by more than 50% andearnings by more than 400 percent.

In 2004, Vogt became the President and CEO of GENBAND (Ribbon Communications), which over the next 9 years, grew from a start-up to more than $700 million in annual revenue and became a global leader of access networking and real-time communication solutions. During Vogt’s nine-year tenure as CEO, the company acquired and integrated ten companies including Nortel VoIP business unit, expanded its operations to more than 50 countries and secured 80 percent of the world’s largest service providers as customers. During Vogt’s tenure, the company experienced a compound annual growth rate of 110 percent and increased operational earnings 9-fold. In 2012, The Wall Street Journal recognized GENBAND as the no. 1 privately backedcompany in America, topping a list of 5,900 companies. Vogt’s first CEO role was in 2002 with an emerging VoIP company, Taqua Systems. Two years later, in 2004, Taqua was acquired by then Tekelec (today, part of Microsoft) delivering a 4x return to shareholders.

Earlier in Vogt’s career, he was instrumental in the operational and financial growth of four standard-setting technology companies including Accelerated Networks (Calix), ADTRAN and Ascend Communications (Nokia). Following Lucent Technologies’ $20 billion acquisition of Ascend Communications in 1999, Vogt became part of the leadership team reporting to then President Carly Fiorina.

Vogt has been an active public speaker and has received numerous awards for his leadership and corporate accomplishments including EY’s “Entrepreneur of the Year,” Dallas’ Tech Titans “Corporate CEO of the Year,” Global Telecoms’ “Power 100,” Inc. 500 “Fastest-Growing Private Companies” and Saint Louis University’s “Hall of Fame”.

Vogt has been featured on Bloomberg TV with Kailey Leinz, Bloomberg Radio with Alisa Parenti, PBS’s CEO with Lee Cullum, Fox Business with Maria Bartimora, CNBC Squawk Box, Fox Business Closing Bell with Liz Claman and CEO Spotlight with KRLD David Johnson.
